alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:37PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Dickson, Humphreys and northwestern Hickman Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 337 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dickson to near New Johnsonville. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dickson, Waverly, Camden, New Johnsonville, McEwen, Burns, Hurricane Mills, Charlotte, Bon Aqua, Pinewood, Bucksnort and I-40 Near The Tennessee River. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 136 and 178. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
